page.title: 03Knockhill Racing Circuit
page.content: Knockhill Racing Circuit is one of the biggest racing circuits in Scotland. The circuit itself lies North West of the town Dunfermline. The circuit is used for motor_car racing,motor cycle racing,solos and sidecars,kart racing and rally cross motocross. It was established in 1971 when 200 acres of rough grazing was bought and Knockhill Racing circuit was set up. The circuit consisted of the track and a few public amenities. At the end of 1984 a change of ownership took place, 130 acres were purchased, the other 70 acres reverted to sheep grazing. Many changes were established. The track was improved, surrounding areas were landscaped. Two permanent cafes and a bar were built and toilet facilities were provided.
